page.title: 01The green hills Drumnakilly
page.content: Green untouched unspoilt criss crossed by streams and rivers oh to live quietly here, is how it strikes you first. Then you walk it and find empty houses falling down, new houses being built, each in its own remote area, you find new drains in the fields, tracts which the tractors have ploughed up to prepare for new cultivation, and you realise that changes are rapidly taking place in that countryside. People, a garage seems to be the only employing agency, except for farms. People must commute to Omagh and Canidmore and beyond. Fields of peat (turf) abound in the left hand grid, dug by locals
